identificationModule.briefTitle: Trial of pRehospital Intervention With trAditional Chinese Medicine for Acute strokE
identificationModule.officialTitle: Trial of pRehospital Intervention With trAditional Chinese Medicine for Acute strokE: A Mixed Methods Research

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: President of the Institute for Encephalopathy, Beijing University of Chinese Medicine

collaborators.name: Beijing Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine
Centre for Evidence Based Chinese Medicine, Beijing University of Chinese Medicine
Beijing Shijitan Hospital, Capital Medical University
Beijing Chaoyang Integrative Medicine Emergency Medical Center
Guang'anmen Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences
Fangshan Hospital，Beijing University of Chinese Medicine
The First Hospital of Fangshan District,Beijing

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The main purpose of this trial is to observe whether Xingnaojing, intravenously administered within 24 hours of symptom onset on pre-hospital emergency ambulance, improves the Early neurological deterioration of acute stroke at 3 days.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The TRACE is a multicenter, registry observational study. Xingnaojing injection is the only essential traditional chinese medicine on emergency ambulance used for acute stroke.The primary hypothesis of this trial is that Xingnaojing used for acute stroke within 24 hours of symptom onset on ambulance will improve the Early neurological deterioration of acute stroke at 3 days. All suspected acute stroke participants will be registered once they are taken on the ambulance. The primary outcome will be determined at 3 days.Besides, there will be a quantitative interview with emergency doctors about their knowledge and attitude on Xingnaojing for acute stroke patients.

armGroups.label: Exposure group(continuously)
armGroups.description: xingnaojing injection will be intravenously administered within 24 hours of symptom onset until to third day (from prehospital ambulance to hospital or at hospital)
interventionNames: Drug: Xingnaojing injection within 24 hours of symptom onset

armGroups.label: Exposure group(uncontinuously)
armGroups.description: xingnaojing injection will be intravenously administered within 24 hours of symptom onset for once (on prehospital ambulance )
interventionNames: Drug: Xingnaojing injection within 24 hours of symptom onset

armGroups.label: Completely unexposed group
armGroups.description: xingnaojing injection will not be intravenously administered within 24 hours of symptom onset until to third day (from prehospital ambulance to hospital)

armGroups.label: Incompletely unexposed group
armGroups.description: xingnaojing injection will not be intravenously administered on ambulance but administered more than 24 hours of symptom onset at hospital

interventions.name: Xingnaojing injection within 24 hours of symptom onset
interventions.description: intravenously administered Xingnaojing injection within 24 hours of symptom onset on ambulance or at hospital

primaryOutcomes.measure: Early neurological deterioration（change between baseline and 3 days)
primaryOutcomes.description: The early neurologic deterioration is defined as an increase of 1 points or more in the National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score between baseline and 3 days. The NIHSS score ranges from 0 (best score) to 42 (worst score).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of stroke related deaths and deaths from any cause
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of stroke related deaths and deaths from any cause during hospitalization
Evaluated by National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and day of discharge or 10 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Intracranial hemorrhage evaluated by Intracerebral Haemorrhage(ICH) scale.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and day of discharge or 10 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Activities of daily living will be measured by Barthel Index (BI)score at 30 days and 90 days.The Barthel Index score ranges from 0 (worst score) to 100 (best score).
The proportion of patients independent will be evaluated by modified Rankin Scale(mRS).The mRS score ranges from 0 (best score) to 6 (worst score).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of suspected acute stroke；
* Symptom onset within 24 hours；
* Age ≥ 18 .

Exclusion Criteria:

* Other conditions that lead to motor dysfunction (e.g., severe osteoarthrosis, rheumatoid arthritis);
* Other conditions that render outcomes or follow-up unlikely to be assessed; Known to be pregnant or breastfeeding;
* Non-acute stroke (result from Computed Tomography(CT) or Magnetic Resonance Imaging(MRI)).
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: suspected acute stroke patient (call for emergency ambulance)

overallOfficials.name: Ying Gao, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Dongzhimen Hospital, Beijing University of Chinese Medicine
